title: Barnsley's Fern
description: An interactive MicroSim demonstrating Barnsley's fern fractal with adjustable parameters for iterations, scale, leaf angle, and curl.
creator: Dan McCreary
subject: Mathematics
Geometry
Fractals
Iterated Function Systems
learningObjectives: Understand how Iterated Function Systems create fractal patterns
Explore the relationship between mathematical parameters and visual appearance
Connect mathematical abstractions to natural forms

controls.name: iterationsSlider
controls.label: Iterations
controls.description: Number of points to plot. More iterations create a denser, more detailed fern.

controls.name: scaleSlider
controls.label: Scale
controls.description: Controls the overall size of the fern display.

controls.name: leafAngleSlider
controls.label: Leaf Angle
controls.description: Adjusts the angle at which leaflets branch from the stem.

controls.name: curlSlider
controls.label: Curl
controls.description: Controls how much the fern tip curls over.

controls.name: spleenwortCheckbox
controls.label: Black Spleenwort Preset
controls.description: Sets all parameters to values that best resemble the black spleenwort fern (Asplenium adiantum-nigrum).

assumptions: Random selection of transformations based on fixed probabilities
limitations: Maximum 200,000 iterations to prevent performance issues
Simplified IFS model compared to real fern complexity
Parameters affect appearance but don't match all real fern species
